course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Imagining Democracy Lab
class_notes:
(Same as POLS  394 2)
Title: Imagining Democracy Lab


This class is the first part of a two-course sequence associated with the Imagining Democracy Lab, a grant-funded initiative to link imagination, knowledge, and action to advance civic and political engagement.


An application is required to be filled out and approved before enrollment in AAS 385/POLS 394 for Fall 2024 is granted. The application is available on our African American Studies department website at aas.emory.edu.


No first year students.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 3590, Section #: 3, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 1-3:45p, Instructor: Anderson/Fraga, Status: Open
